Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Christine22_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading other reviews. The hotel is in a convenient location, not far from the termini, which was useful for getting around. The room was clean and tidy, as was the bathroom. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. There was plenty of choice for breakfast. Like someone else who wrote a review, we used the Conod supermarket on the corner for buying water & other supplies. Ate at the Steakhouse restaurant round the corner twice- good value for money in a city which can be quite expensive! Would recommend the Camelia for a short break!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, look no further”
Reviews.Author: Barbara426
Reviews.Content: Really nice little hotel in Rome, very close to the railway station about 5-10 min walk. Market very close, but hawkers can be a bit of a pain. The area is OK, the hotel is opposite the police station, and it was OK to pop out in the evening for dinner. The staff were very informative on the sights to see in Rome and set you off in the right direction. The breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay - good quality and location”
Reviews.Author: Krzysztof D
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the 3 night stay - the room was very nice - not too big but cosy, huuuge bed. Just returned from the 3 night stay - the room was very nice - not too big but cozy, huuuge bed. Although the windows were out on the streets it was very calm when they were closed. The breakfast was ok - and the staff at the reception very helpful and nice. And also very good location - 5 mins to Termini from you can easily communicate with other parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaker83
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights in Rome at the Hotel Camelia. This great little hotel is convenient for the Termini station (about 5 mins walk) and central for all the sights. We only used the metro once to go to Vatican City. The hotel is spotlessly clean with lovely rooms and bathrooms; the staff are very helpful and there is a lovely buffet breakfast served in a really nice room. On the last day we were allowed to keep our room til 12 o' clock, which was very useful. This hotel is really good value for money and we would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for Rome Visit”
Reviews.Author: DaveVA08
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this location was for 3 nights on a joint trip to Paris. Rome was our second stop of the trip and we found this hotel to fit our needs perfectly. Our room was 106 on the first floor. It was very spacious (compared to our Paris hotel) and the room was clean and comfortable with a king size bed. Breakfast was included as well with our nightly rate and was great so we wouldn't have to go out for breakfast every morning. That alone probably saved us 15 or so euros every morning for the 2 of us. Every staff member was very accommodating and helped with any question we had. We walked to several sites from the hotel and we also utilized the TramBus Open 110 from the Termini Station. It was a great location to get around with several good restaurants within short walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced location for your trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovesbreaksaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my fiance and mum and dad . Really nice hotel if your looking clean friendly basic hotel. Great location 5min walk to main terminal station were we used the tourist bus. 48 hours £26 0r 20 for 24hours with the green rome bus. hotel sells tickets for a different bus its 30 but there is cheeper out there. there is another bus red which is only 15 for 24 hours and 20 for 48 hours. steak house around the corner great steaks alot of places very expensive it was reasonable. Over all hotel and rome was an amazing experience .

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: PaulLinnet
Reviews.Content: The Camelia hotel is small and charming and very well located. We loved the morning breakfasts and especially the delicious cappuccino! The room was extremely clean, comfortable and beautifully decorated. Within a few short blocks you have access to everything. I would highly recommend going to Rome and staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great value, near Termini”
Reviews.Author: uclabobby
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 4 nights and have no complaints. We found a very good rate on one of the major hotel websites. All of the staff seemed friendly and spoke English well. The breakfast was above average, with all of the usuals including cereal meats and cheeses, breads and dessert cakes, boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, and also mozzarella balls. There was a juice machine and the staff made coffee drinks to order. The room (320) was at the end of a hallway and was much larger and nicely appointed than I was expecting. Room access is by a magnetized card, and the front desk is open late. One time I arrived to a closed door, around 11pm, but a quick touch of the buzzer and the desk man arrived a few seconds later. I suppose this hotel is considered to be in the Termini area (about a 10 minute walk) but it did not seem seedy or uncomfortable in any way. They are plenty of restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk (the front desk recommended 3 to me). The windows are soundproofed and whenever I opened the window and leaned out, it was actually very quiet. It is close to both the Termini and Repubblica metro stops. The only concerns to note were 1) the tv control seemed particularly difficult to use. I think I actually deprogrammed it while trying to get it to work. Something about "press tv" to get local channels and "press..." to get international channels. Also the free wifi is provided through out of those freehotspot.com setups. It seemed that every 25 minutes or so, the service would disconnect and I would be given the screen to re-enter my password and username. I received a strong signal while sitting at the work desk, but when moving to a different part of the room, the signal was noticeably weaker. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for its value, for the Termini area and for all of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ullasishere
Reviews.Content: Camelia is a nice little hotel located in a quiet street close to the Termini station. The rooms are not too big but very well decorated. The comfort factor is surely there. Surely the shower is a bit small but again very clean. It is an ideal place for a short stay in Rome. The staff is very helpful and accomodated a lot to our special dietary needs. Special thanks to the lady in the kitchen, whom we couldnt thank properly as we didnt know Italian. Also the guy on the reception helps a lot by letting you know all route plans for your visit. Do ask him for recommended restaurants near by. We didnt drop our bags at the hotel, which is free service and had to pay Euro 5 for 5 hours at the termini station and stand in queue for 25 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice !”
Reviews.Author: Hans074
Reviews.Content: It is a nice small hotel with a tipycal roman flair. The rooms are small but cosy, with everything you need in it, and very important, it was clean. Very friendly and helpfull staff, gives us good advice about restaurants. Great breakfast, with enough variety to choose of. Coffee machine in the lobby also helpfull. Good location, easy to find when you arrive from the airport at Termini, when coming back from the city, then better choose Reppublica station to reach the hotel. For your psychical safety, you can spot the police station across the street. When I have to complain about something, this was a sort of noise made by the ventilation system during the night, but after a day long of walking in Rome this was not a real problem. I would come back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Hotel Camelia!”
Reviews.Author: Allie H
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Camelia. The hotel is located right by the Termini train station which has metro connections to all the major sights. The hotel room was tasteful and elegant and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. I honestly don't have anything but good things to say about Hotel Camelia!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location, good triple room”
Reviews.Author: Reena_111
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, short walk from Termini train station. We found it very easy to find, granted we did check out Google maps before going. We arrived in the early evening and the desk staff at that time was very friendly and helpful, showing us a map and letting us know where all the "famous" sights were. We really did not have any dealings with the day staff other than to say our hellos and good-byes. We were able to walk to all the major sights although, in fairness, some (St Peter's Basilica) were quite a distance away. If you are not big on walking, it would be very easy to go to the Termini station and take a metro to stops near where you want to go. There is a great, reasonably priced restaurant around the corner, as well as a grocery and convenience store. The hotel itself was clean, including our room which was well maintained. It is located across the street from a police station so, rightly or wrongly, we felt safe. We only had two issues with this hotel. First was the water pressure in the shower/bath. If it is important for you to have a good, strong, hot shower then this is not the room (place?) for you. We were on the fourth floor and, at best, the water was very warm, and the pressure was (extremely) minimal. Our daughter was able to have a warm-ish bath, but only after a very long wait for the water to trickle into the tub. The second issue was that each morning, at breakfast, we had to ask for the trays to be refilled as they would sit empty until you did. Having said that, the wait staff were extremely nice and quick to bring us coffee as soon as we arrived. For us it was a shame about those two issues as, despite the fact that we liked the hotel in general, and thought the location quite ok, we would probably do another investigation / search for a different hotel if we went back to Rome. Not sure we would return here but might. Guess you could say that we are sitting on the fence right now.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: grlzride2
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel we have ever stayed at! The desk staff were rude, the room was REALLY SMALL and DIRTY! The bathroom door only opened HALFWAY because it was blocked by the toilet, the tub didn't drain and had a disgusting ring around the tub, there were stains all over the walls, the bed was like sleeping on a rock and there was barely enough room to walk around the bed! Oh and the lights and all electricity go out when you remove your key from the holder, I was really hot out while we were there and we came back after a long day of walking in the heat to a HOT ROOM! The TV was high on the wall at the foot of the bed and only about 20 inches big. This place is a dump! And the location wasn't good either there were several fights outside the hotel. I didn't add photos to this review because I didn't take any, I was embarrassed that we stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sandlesGeelong
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a night in October 2011 and was pleasantly surprised-the room was spacious, breakfast plentiful and staff most helpful. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “40th wedding present”
Reviews.Author: jim19479
Reviews.Content: We have just returned 10th october 2011 from this hotel it is 7 minutes walk from staion termini where the terravision bus stops the hotel is spotless the rooms have doublr glazing so no noise and the staff are very good full of good information.If you walk to top of the road which is via sepembre you can get to most of the sites in 20 minutes like spanish steps the trevi fountain presidents palace and another 5 minutes many more the bus or metro 1euro for 75minutes any bus or metro. would i go back to this hotel i most certainly would the breakfast was good fresh rolls cereals parma ham and cheeses fruit tea and coffee you can also use free the computer so 10/10 from my wife and myself.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mb0511
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the hotel Camelia and can only recommend it warm-heartedly! Having stayed in Italian hotels previously, this is one of the best 3* hotels I ever stayed at, considering Italian standards. The hotel is a 5-10 minutes walk away from the Termini station, thus very centrally and also conveniently located. Despite its central location, the street of hotel is pretty quiet and the windows are so extremely well isolated that one does not hear any cars passing by which guarantees for a very good sleep. Some of the sights can be reached by foot, such as for example the Spanish steps, which are only a 15 minutes walk away...similarly the Fontana di Trevi. A supermarket is located close by the hotel, just down the street. The hotel itself is pretty, the rooms appear new and they are neatly designed. The size of a double room is just right, the bathroom is spacy, though the only downside is the lack of room for toileteries in the bathroom itself. But that was about the only negative of staying in that hotel. The rooms are cleaned daily. New towels are provided daily. The personnel of the hotel, whether that is the reception, the breakfast room or the cleaning lady are very friendly. Especially, the reception is extremely helpful and can answer all questions especially in guiding you to the various sights or which public transportation to take etc. The breakfast is very much Italian style, i.e. do not expect a luxurious buffet. There is a selection of white bread, croissants and toast, jam, cheese, salami, cake and cornflakes. We selected this hotel based on previous reviews written here - we can confirm that they accurately convey the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel186346
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 11:00 to a very warm welcome but was told our room was not ready, "come back in 1 hour" no problem we were early so walked around the corner found a bar and relaxed for an hour drinking a cold beer in the glorious sunshine. Upon entering the room I was pleasantly surprised, the room was spacious, very clean and quiet. The bathroom was spotless (contained a bath) and toileteries were provided. Throughout our stay we were not disturbed by any noise. The hotel staff was very helpful and accomodating. We transferred from Ciampino airport via bus which we boarded outside Arrivals (cost 4 euro each single way, 40 minutes), the hotel is approx 5 minutes walk. The hotel is approx 15 minute walk away from The Collossseum and many other sights. We liked everything about our stay, the only dislike was having to leave! This was our second visit to Rome so probably will not go back, if we did we would certainly go back to Hotel Camelia

Reviews.Title: “Great thats it just Great”
Reviews.Author: esolman
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in may. Amazing location about a 10-15 walk to the Colosseum and 5 mins probs not evern that to the Termini stations. Rooms were nice and clean and we slept well. Breakfast not loads of choice but the is enough to fill you up and as they say when in rome. The staff were great as I had booked a private return taxi with Cresta well worth the extra money and the hotel called the taxi company to confirm our pick up time no problem they are happy to help. All in all a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Airconditioning and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: griftsno1capper
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and cold, had a safe, and was staff was helpful. No wireless but they have a computer with free internet in the lobby. Was close (10 min walk) from Rep. and Ter. stations for the Metro. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Rome break”
Reviews.Author: marmin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June and had a good time. The hotel is clean, the room while not luxurious is perfectly comfortable and the staff are helpful and pleasant so difficult to find any faults worth mentioning. The breakfast had limited choice (pastries, fruit, yoghurts and toast) but had enough and what was offered was fresh and tasty. Also had decent free wi-fi throughout the hotel. The train and bus station are less than 10 mins walk away to get further afield although we also walked from here to Trevi fountain/Pantheon/Piazza Navona area without too much difficulty. Would recommend the open top bus tours from near the bus station - we took the 2 day hop on - hop off bus with Christian Rome - very efficient and great value to see the sights and to get about generally. Would also recommend the restaurant around the corner from Camelia (on way to train station). The hotel receptionist recommended it and we had a lunch and dinner there - good food and good value for Rome. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Charming Staff”
Reviews.Author: MollyandMabrysMama
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I took a multi-city trip to Italy and we were fortunate enough to get "stuck" at this hotel. We had an unfortunate event after we relied on the incompetant idiot at the train station to arrange a hotel for us, and after we schlepped our baggage 6 blocks to another hotel that she claimed was the "cheapest one she could find." Turns out she had not even bothered to check that they had availability. BUT Antonio at XX Settiembre (which, is where she sent us) was kind enough to not only allow us to use his computer, but he called the idiot girl at the train station to fuss at her for not first checking his availability and then - while I ran back to get my money credited back to my card - found us another hotel (Hotel Camelia) for us to stay for the 2 nights we needed. AND it was less expensive than what we were expecting. We must have dealt with at least 5-6 staff members at Camelia and every single one of them acted as if they were ecstatic that we were 1) staying with their hotel, 2) asking them for anything, and 3) enjoying out stay. They treated my mother and me as if we were routine guests! They have a lovely layout, a very comfortable room, in-room wifi - that's free - and a pleasent outlook towards their guests! They even made dinner restaurants on our behalf! The only "complaint" that I have was that their breakfast could have been more extensive... but it was continental which is what they provided.. so no real complaints..

Reviews.Title: “Great place for weekend trip!”
Reviews.Author: Langemakki
Reviews.Content: nice welcome with quick checkin. Good explanation about location and free city map. Room is large, enough storage, TV, free safe. Bathroom with seperate shower, all clean. Double windows so no noise from the street. Even close to the lift and no noise from the lift. Nice walking distance from city center, aprox. 25 min to Spanish Steps. Would return!

Reviews.Title: “Not honest with booking”
Reviews.Author: CherJoy
Reviews.Content: After reading online reviews this booking was made with Hotel Camelia via Venere.com. When we arrived at the Hotel we were told that the booking was actually with their sister hotel Best Western ArtDeco which was another block away. As were walking with our luggage we were not happy. The Hotel ArtDeco was a bit tired and rundown. Our room was small and the bathroom had no water pressure which meant just a trickle of water from the basin, slightly more from the shower which made a shower difficult, washing hair would have been impossible. Staff took note of the problem but were not too concerned. When checking out staff confused our account with another room. Bar staff served a drink then disappeared, hard to find when we wanted to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with nice room in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DoruP
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife and my son (11 years old), in a long weekend. Location is great and is 15 minutes walk to the central station Termini - it made transfers in and out of Rome very easy! It's also, nearby to Metro station. A lot of people warned us about staying near Termini station but the hotel was in a safe street (opposite the local police station) and we never had any problems. You are almost in the centre of town, within a 30 minute walk of all sights. Breakfast was continental, there was plenty to suit all tastes (coffee, tee, milk and juice). The room was clean and pleasant, and staff were attentive, friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. If I ever go back to Rome, I would certainly stay to Camelia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent, Clean and Comfortable Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travellingdonut
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome during one of the busiest times of the year - Easter AND the beautification of the late Pope so I found it hard to find a hotel at first. My friend finally found Hotel Camelia had vacancies and I was a bit nervous as so many other places were booked out. We weren't disappointed and were only impressed. The hotel rooms were clean and spacious and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was also very impressive and extensive! The staff were very helpful on giving maps and tips about Rome and helping us with our questions. A lot of people warned us about staying near Termini station but the hotel was in a safe street and we never had any problems. It was also idea being a 10 -15 minute walk from Termini as it made transfers in and out of Rome very easy! All in all, I'd highly recommend the Hotel Camelia for it's high standard as a very decent reliable place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again if I am ever lucky enough to be back in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Kiara_11
Reviews.Content: Lovely, fairly small hotel in a beautiful city. The location is excellent for a weekend trip, with the central station less than a ten minute walk away, from where you can catch sightseeing buses around the city, the metro to other parts of Rome, and trains to the airport. The room was clean and pleasant, and staff were attentive, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MosterMalla
Reviews.Content: Perfect little hotel by Termini station! Nice staff and very clean and nice rooms! A little far from the most intresting parts of Rome, but a walk for about 30 minutes take you to Coleseum! The windows in the hotel was fantastic. Lots of noise from the street, but with the window closed it was totaly quit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for a sightseeing base with good support from staff”
Reviews.Author: MacScout
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel doesn't seem much, once inside you realise you are in a classy hotel with attentive staff. The rooms are a good size for two adults and comfortable, although I expect they could be a little warm in the summer. The quiet location opposite the local police station belies the fact that you are almost in the centre of town within a 30 minute walk of all sights and less than 5 minutes from excellent restaurants. Breakfast was continental only in style, there was plenty to suit all tastes, and the tea and coffee were freshly made on arrival. A good, relatively quiet hotel, the only drawback was that you could hear other guests through the fairly thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice for all kind of travellers!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emilia060282
Reviews.Content: The hotel was one of the best 3 star hotels I have ever been. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was clean and the bouffet of the breakfast had all kinds of food (very important for those who need a good breakfast to start their day!). The location was near Termini Station (about 5 minutes by foot), with a supermarket across the corner. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. If I ever go back to Rome, I would certainly stay to Camelia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitney_j0508
Reviews.Content: The internet and tv did not work for half of our trip. The jacuzzi tub didn't work. The breakfast was absolutely terrible. You could hear every word from the room next door. The bed felt like you were sleeping on the floor. There were silverfish in the bed and when we confronted the front desk they said...oh yeah they fall from the ceiling...like it was an ordinary occurence. On a happier note, they did have a neat drink machine downstairs where you could get free coffee, hot chocolate, cappachino, espresso, etc. Also it was in a great location, only 5 min walk to main trasportation terminal, "termini".

Reviews.Title: “Booking was confirmed but no room available”
Reviews.Author: YMLUK
Reviews.Content: I booked a room directly at the hotel's own website. We arrived at the hotel after 11pm (which I had notified at the time of booking), only to find out that the hotel did not have any room for us and they were transfering us to another hotel nearby. I took time to choose this hotel and was excited to stay here, but am disappointed with the way this was handled. Granted I had only booked the day before, I feel that I should have been informed of the fact that the hotel was overbooked prior to arrival so that I could have made an alternative arrangement. The hotel they transferred us to did not in any way meet our expectation. We changed to a different hotel the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Small Clean Room located near public transportation”
Reviews.Author: ASHMD
Reviews.Content: The room was quite small but we expected this. I would say our double room was approximately 8 feet wide by 11 feet long not including the bathroom. The shower stall was TINY. If you put your elbows up you could touch both sides. However, it was clean and safe. The front desk staff was indifferent but adequate. No special friendliness but they met our needs. Not sure if this was because we were American or not but they seemed bothered that they had to check us in the hotel at all. The waiter in the breakfast room was fantastic. Always hustling and went out of his way to make you feel welcome. I overheard him speaking Italian, French and English to various patrons. The breakfast was sufficient to get you going in the morning and we appreciated that it was included in the room. We were only a 10 minute walk from the train station (Termini) which also houses both Metro Lines. We used public transportation a bit but also enjoyed walking the city. I would recommend this hotel to others like us who don't require a lot of niceties or attention. The room was adequate albeit small and the staff was ok. For the price we paid (a little over $100 a night) it worked just fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a not so great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: bikercats
Reviews.Content: We found the staff helpful, the room comfortable, clean, and well appointed. We'd never been to Rome and didn't know the neighborhoods. This is quite close to Termini and across the street from a police station, it is a less than desirable area to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: Ontemove
Reviews.Content: Refurbished hotel, close to the terminus but still quiet and relaxing. Some cramped rooms, but not bad for the price. My attic room was big, but without any windows to the street. No problem. AC worked great, nice, friendly staff, spotless cleaning, free safe, decent continental breakfast. Very unstable wifi the only problem. Recommanded!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean - location ok”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraCCL
Reviews.Content: Middle class hotel, not so far from Termini station, in a quiet street. 20 to 30 minutes walking from the most important sights (which we thought ok as we don't mind walking). Small rooms (very small bathroom), but nicely furnished and most importantly, clean! Breakfast was ok in quality, but very limited in choice. Friendly staff. Free internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: MELTED_10
Reviews.Content: This must be one of Rome's hidden gems! The most comfortable bed we have ever slept on and completely quiet despite being in the city.Breakfast was continental and internet access was available free of charge in the lobby. The safe in our room was also free of charge and a great perk was the free coffee machine in the lobby which you could help yourself to. Staff were kind and friendly nothing was too much trouble and their english was good. The hotel is close to a few pavement restaurants/cafe's and opposite a police station so very safe! It's only a ten minute walk from the metro and train station. I left some of my belongings behind in a draw and following a phone call they were only too pleased to either arrange a courier or post them to my home in Scotland. I got them back yesterday!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location, rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: HelenBell76
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at this hotel and would highly recommend it. The location is great - 5/10 minute walk from the central train/metro station and from where the Terravision bus drops you off from the airport. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was spotless with air conditioning, mini bar, safe and plenty of storage space, the buffet breakfast (cereals, pastries, bread, jam and fruit) was great and the location and double glazing meant that you weren't disturbed by any road noise. There is also a supermarket at the end of the road which is ideal and plenty of restaurants dotted around the area. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Clean, tidy, friendly and well located.”
Reviews.Author: woowoo1106
Reviews.Content: We took a coach from the airport to the nearby train station at a cost of only 4 Euro. the taxi's were charging 50 Euro! (money saved bought pair of shoes!). The hotel is a 5 min walk away from where the coach drops you off. A huge supermarket is by the hotel too - ideal for snacks and drinks. The Hotel itself is a small hotel. The staff are very friendly, even the cleaner who was lovely. He always worked very hard. the windows are all double glazed so you hear nothing when closed. The air cond was brilliant - you can change the direction of air and speed and temp - fantastic. We had clean towels and soaps etc every day. The shower was hot, bathroom clean. Our beds were made when we were at breakfast. Spare pillow in wardrobe, also free safe. Bar too if you need it - but go to supermarket as is only down the road. The breakfast has fresh fuit, , yogurts, cereals, jams, pastries, cakes, prunes, nuts, bread buns and all sorts of pre packed cakes and melba toasts. The hotel is next door to a deli, and opposite a police station!! You feel very safe. Lovely local restaurants, which we noticed lots of local italians ate at - which reassured us. It was an ideal base for us, and we will definately stay there again. Just remember to try the coach/bus as you will save a fortune and besides, it's more exciting!!! The buses leave to go to the airport every hour. There is a free internet computer there - very handy to rub in to frineds on Facebook what a fantastic time I was having!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lfelippe
Reviews.Content: After reading so good references in Tripadvisor (and taking it in consideration I booked a room well in advance for 4 days starting on August 9th, 2010) I was completely frustrated upon arriving in such hotel. After a long flight to Europe we arrived at the hotel to hear that unfortunately it was overbooked and a room was arranged at their sister property Best Western ArtDeco. It sounds such hotel is playing again and again such trick (or scam!) since a previous review described the same situation (there is such same complain in review "Unfortunate Circumstance" dated July 16, 2010). Hotel Camelia ranks 150th and ArtDeco 281st and they may be using Hotel Camelia as a bait for Hotel ArtDeco.

Reviews.Title: “More than just a tourist hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MisterEtraveller
Reviews.Content: During the 7 days I stayed at the Hotel Camelia Rome was hotter than usual. The local newscasts reported it was 50º in some of the metro stations. Outside on the streets it was a humid 43º. The A/C in my room at the Camelia was excellent - I actually had to turn it off at night for hours at a time. The hotel caters to business people and tourists. In my opinion this tends to cause the level of service and amenities to be better than usual because the hotel is trying to earn frequent repeat patronage from the business crowd. As a result, the quality of the rooms is very good. Towels, bedding and linens are above average. There's a mini-fridge for the beer and water you can buy at one of 3 convenience stores within a few minutes of the hotel. 10 minutes away is Termini Stazione with direct train service to the airport and the convergence point for both of Rome's metro lines. The breakfast is good quality continental served with coffee so good I didn't miss Starbucks. I found this hotel by using Google's Streetview. When I looked it up here on TA it was a bit buried in the pile of reviews but I think it deserves better. I've stayed at other hotels in the same area in past years but Camelia is ta better hotel for less money than the others - all of which had slightly inflated prices as a result of being mentioned in guide books.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phillyexp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Camelia (July 8th - on) for approx. 9 days ( I say approximately because we went to Sorrento/Capri for 3 days). The first thing you notice is how clean and fresh the place looks and feels. Really outstanding and very important to us. The front desk (especially Geno) were really nice. He did everything he could to make our stay comfortable especially since we had 2 rooms for the 6 of us. The rooms we got were large and clean with nice wood floors and good sized bathrooms. We did hit Rome at a hot spell so our rooms weren’t as cool as they should have been being that that were on top of the Hotel and Rome was really hot. The staff help out by giving us fans which helped a lot. The fourth (top) floor rooms are BIG with high ceilings. Hence the issue with the heat. It was fine though and in fact they moved our kids down to the 1st floor to another cooler room. You get free wireless (go to the front desk to get an access card) that worked well. TV had a few channels, 2 in English – but who cares we didn’t come to Italy to watch TV. If you want news from home use your free wireless access. The breakfast room was really perfect for the 6 of us (not as small as some other people on this website have said – I think they must’ve been expecting a bowling alley sized breakfast area.) It was nicely lit and very comfortable – food provided was right on time. Good stuff featuring juices, hard-boiled eggs, prosciutto and cheese pies, crème filled pastries, cereal and lots of fruit. Any kind of coffee (cappuccino was real good) or tea you’d like (via made to order from the very quick and nice staff). Plus they’ve got an Express Cappuccino and tea maker in the lobby available all the time. It’s also close to everything including Termini Station (8 minutes walk). Plenty of Restaurants around – eat outside with the Italians – the tourists eat inside. The Steak Pizzeria nearby is real good. We liked RISTORANTE IL SORRISO also which was a few blocks away - Free glasses of wine and a plate full of biscotti at the end of your meal. I didn’t see any McDonald’s - THANK GOD!!! The Hotel Camelia’s neighborhood was safe and we also had a supermarket down the street. They close the nearby street for merchants certain days and you can get some pretty decent stuff (make sure you bargain with them). This is way better that a 3 star hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate Circumstance”
Reviews.Author: rykylex
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the fantastic reviews about Hotel Camelia, we were so disappointed as to how we were treated. After a long transatlantic flight from the U.S. we arrived at the hotel and was quite disappointed when the hotel clerk notified us that they were having "electrical problems". He stated that he made reservations to their sister hotel right down the street which he claimed was a lot better since it was rated a 4 star Best Western. I was traveling with my sister and my mother (70 years old). Although Best Western was a couple of blocks away, they didn't offer to lift one finger nor offer to assist us in getting our luggage there. It was just very inconvenient and I don't think that throwing us into Best Western Art Deco was a fair compensation. Their rooms were old and smelled, their bathrooms smelled like urinals, their TV didn't have any English/American channels, the air condition system barely worked, and the service was non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, Courteous”
Reviews.Author: starickman
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Hotel Camelia. It is about a five minute walk to Termini Train/Metro/Bus station, and you can get anywhere from there. There are several cafes down the street, a supermarket a block away, and the oldest wine shop in Rome is also on the street. There are also a bank and ATM down the street. The hotel staff were very helpful. If you want a taxi, they push a button at the front desk, and within minutes, your taxi arrives. We arranged hotel transfers to and from the airport through the hotel, and the cars were early. The hotel was spotlessly clean. The room had plenty of space for the king bed plus twin for our teenaged daughter, an armoire so you can unpack, desk, mini fridge, plus open floor space. The bathroom was large. The hotel was remodeled a few years ago, so everything is new. Breakfast (included) was plentiful, including cereal, eggs, rolls, and fruit. Air condiitoning is controlled in your room. There is a free internet-connected computer in the lobby, plus free wi-fi throughout the hotel although the signal sometimes went out. If you're desperate for American food, there's a McDonalds at the Piazza de Republica about five minutes away (a very large, nice McDonalds by the way - our teenager craved fries!). The hotel was very quiet - a major requirement for us. The street is not busy.

Reviews.Title: “clean, professional, and decent location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Beans2000
Reviews.Content: This was one the best hotels I stayed in in Italy. We have several bad experiences at other places (problems with cleanliness, mattresses being old, unprofessional staff), none of which we experienced here. The location is near Termini, a 10 minute walk from the Metro or train station, and about a 30 minute walk to the Coleseum. It is not in the "trendy" part of town, but that is why you get more for your money. It is on a quiet street without throngs of tourists. The staff was professional. The room was clean, the mattresses were firm, there was free wi-fi (although didn't work well in my room on the first floor), the breakfast had more options than just pastries. I would stay here again. Good bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: GraemeC17
Reviews.Content: This little gem is in a quiet part of Rome, about 10 minutes walk from the Termini. There is a great supermarket 50 metres down the street which, for us, was really handy. The rooms are very comfortable without being lavish and the hotel spotlessly clean. The breakfasts are more then sufficient without being gourmetand the staff are very helpful. We had an early morning tour one of our days and the kitchen staff packed us a lovely breakfast box to take with us at no extra charge. Another touch which we really appreciated was a hot drink dispenser in the foyer, complimentary for the duests. Overall a really good option for Rome which we would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire_TravelHog
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal hotel for a city trip to Rome and we'd be happy to stay here again. The hotel is conveniently located for all the sights and there are numerous restaurants near by. We ate in the Steak House Ristorante Pizzeria which is 250 metres from the hotel (turn right out of the hotel and right again). They did a good selection of meat dishes, pasta and pizzas all at a very good price for Rome. Also near by is the Metro and pick up points for the open top bus tours although if you take the blue bus operated by Ciao Roma (the one recommended by the hotel) then beware of stop number 13 on weekdays (stop number 3 weekends) because if the traffic is bad not all the buses actually stop there. The best one is number 16 weekdays (19 weekends) The hotel is close enough (600 metres) to the station to be able to walk from it although with suitcases some people may find it too tiring. The station is huge and the platform that serves the airport is a long way from the Via Marsala exit so expect a long walk (500 metres) inside the station complex. Breakfast is adequate and although the breakfast room is small the service is efficient and the tables get turned around quickly. The hotel is quiet which is nice if you have spent all day in the hustle and bustle of Rome and the air conditioning efficient, we also liked the free internet access so we could check-in on line 24hrs before our departure. The free city map provided by the hotel upon check-in was brilliant and invaluable. We found the staff on reception to be friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: BogtrotterBelfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night and chose as local to train station. Was rather difficult to find. Elegant hotel with hepfull staff and nice room with balcony. Good choice at breakfast and lovely coffee..however it was a rather cramped dining room. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Centric, comfortable, but a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: miguelfc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this cozy hotel a couple of days, and the service was pretty good. We had no problems checking in, and the room was really clean and organized, it was exactly like the pictures on their website. Breakfast was included in the service, not spectacular but the coffee was great. The hotel didn't have a restaurant, but in the street behind and in the surroundings were a few local restaurants. The location is excellent, the hotel is five minutes walking to termini station. Although it was a little expensive, it was worth it (it was high season at the time of our visit too)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: sd44
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute after a horrible experiance in florence, and were pleasantly surprised. Location- This hotel was about 5 mins walking distance from the main train station but you might want to get directions from mapquest/googlemaps because the websites directions aren't the clearest. It was also very close to the piazza de republica. There is a good "steak house" with great prices on the first street to the right of the hotel. The rooms weren't extravagant but they were clean and spacious. Our room had one room with a queen sized bed and then another room on the other side of the bathroom with a twin bed which would be great if you were traveling in a group. The included breakfast was good and had the typical european breakfast items plus a egg and sausage tart, and a few other items. In the lobby they also have free internet for hotel guests. Getting around- We used a hop on/off bus service to get around the city and there were 2 stop that were easily walkable. One by the main train station and one by the piazza de republica. In general the hotel was comfortable and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gobabu
Reviews.Content: It is located in very nice place, we felt comfortable to roam in Rome from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2007 in a dbl room with other family members in a triple room next door, both on the top floor. This time my husband and I decided to splash out on the triple room just for ourselves so we could have that extra space. Just like last time the room was a generous size and very comfy indeed. The bathroom was also a good size and had the added bonus of a spa bath. I particulary love the skylights which can be opened. This time we caught the Leonardo Express train which runs from the airport to Roma Termini station and walked to the hotel from there. It is not very far. We walked everywhere again and this hotel is very well located for that and has plently of restaurants, take-aways and a good little supermarket close by. Breakfast was as good as it was 2 years ago with a good and varied selection of yummy foods presented in a bright and attractive dining room. Definetely good value for money and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: 0X0
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, great location, bright clean room. Supermarket and restaurants all close by. Walking distance to Metro and all sights. A BRILLIANT hotel for spending time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: USinFrance
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Camelia, 3 in one room, 2 in another. The rooms were large by Rome standards, very clean and breakfast included was good. The staff were very helpful and called around to get us a last-minute taxi pronto to get us to the airport. Free access to the house computer for access to the internet. The triple room we had was very nice and modern my only comment is that the 3rd bed was a fold-out chair and I wouldn't suggest anyone other than a child to sleep in it. It was fine for my 11-year old son. Easy access to the train station and busses, not a great selection of restaurants just nearby though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: licia_flo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on other comments on Trip Advisor. I can confirm that the hotel is a little jewel in Rome! The location is great, close the Termini Station, with plenty of nice restaurant in the area. The hotel is very clean, the breakfast is good, and the room are well isolated (at least mine was). The staff is very friendly! If in Rome again I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very tidy and clean”
Reviews.Author: fatfin
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, only 10 minutes walk from our drop off point from the railway station. Easy to find. Friendly staff and cheery. The breakfast was tasty with plenty to choose from. The room was spacious and the bathroom very clean. Easy walking distance to the underground and bus networks. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a Rome city break”
Reviews.Author: Ourlastsummer
Reviews.Content: The Camelia is a new hotel, tastefully decorated and very comfortable. Rooms are surprisingly spacious, ours was at the back of the hotel and was very quiet. The staff are very friendly and helpful with plenty of useful information about the city and all speak excellent English. Breakfast is a good buffet choice. Location is great for transport as it's very near Termini Station for trains from the airport, the Metro and sightseeing tours.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel - i will go back!”
Reviews.Author: happy-holls-cj
Reviews.Content: Hotel Camelia is a 5-10 min safe walk from termini train station therefore ideal for airport transfer buses, metro, tour buses etc. Very safe area with good choice of restaurants/bars within 5-10 min walk. Small restaurant literally next door to hotel open evenings from 5pm only but food very enjoyable and reasonable. Fairly large supermarket at one end of street good for stocking up as able to store items in hotel room mini bar. Initial contact with hotel via email and they were most helpful. On arrival a member of grou[p was unwell and reception staff with very nice and helped us any way they could. I travelled as 3 friends and were given 1 single room and 2 doubles for single use. Single room was small but spotlessley clean as was whole hotel. Doubles were extremely spacious and all equiped with mini bar, free safe, ample storage, tv, bath/shower, toiletries. For 3* in Rome very good. Only slight issue was single room toilet would not flush but maid got it working and showed us this but next day wouldn't work again! Breakfast fairly simple continental with cereals, fruit, yoghurts, bread/rolls, juice/tea/coffee, pastries and processed cheeses (no meats) but very nice and well stocked all morning (7am-10am). Hotel has free internet access, free tea/coffee all day in reception, lift but no bar and no problem to leave suitcases on check in/out day. Also small toilet area used to get changed in before late transfer back to airport. Altogether very good hotel, pleasant area, helpful staff and spotless! Very good rates available through bookassist.com (approx 60/65 euro per room per night) with small deposit payable on booking and balance direct to hotel at end of stay. Also good late deals on hotels own website. Rome is my favourite city and am really pleased to have found Hotel Camelia as having stayed in quite a few 3* tourist hotels in Rome before I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great price , great service and cant say a bad thing about our stay here”
Reviews.Author: mssmiley09
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend were worried beacause we got such a good price and wondered if there must be something not right. We knew beacause it was near the train station the location might be a bit rough.. However, on arrival at the hotel, I was impressed, the receptionist was friendly and rooms were clean. Some might say the rooms were small but I had no complaints as we were out and about all the time. Local restaurants were cheap and for something more fancy a trip on the metro wasnt far away. It was easy enough to visit all the major sights as the metro was 5mins away. Breakfast was standard and every morning I availed of it. There was a little tea and coffee machine was great to have. All in all I was pleasantly surprised

Reviews.Title: “Came back for the second time, and still the best”
Reviews.Author: dahpewe
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend hotel Camelia. A nice small hotel, excellent service, clean, nice rooms ( we even get a nicer room than before this time). The people at the front desk was very nice and helpful. Still the same people as two years a go when we first stay at this hotel. One morning, we had to go for a day tour very early, and one of them prepared us 2 bags of breakfast (croissant, cookies, orange juice, omelette and boiled egg) so that we won't miss our breakfast. We didn't even ask! :) The location is superb. Close to supermarket, restaurants and 10 minutes walk to Termini station. Would love to stay again for our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Mini Break”
Reviews.Author: jeff1980
Reviews.Content: Id recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good base to see the main sites of rome. Placed in between 3 stops on the metro (lines A and B), one of which is the main Termini Station, and maybe a 20 minute walk to the trevi fountain and the pantehon. The rooms arent huge but are more than sufficient, with air con and safe (both of which are free). The breakfast is excellent with Coffee and Juices, Bread, cheeses and Eggs, plus cereals and cakes, and the free internet setup is also brilliant. The location is quiet but not hostile and there are several small and well priced restaurants dotted in the streets around the hotel, all offering a 2 course meal plus wine for 30 euros (per couple). The whole city is superb and with so much to see you need somewhere thats easy to come back to and crash out in after a long days walking - this certainly ticks all the boxes. One thing that i would tell people to be careful of are the Roman Centurions. Be firm and say no if they ask for a photo, we lost out on 40 euros due to one group taking just 4 pictures! A few other key points for first time visitors to rome. If you arrive at Ciampino airport use terravision coaches to get to the city centre - cheap and efficient. The cost of the Vatican was 14 euros each - do not believe them when they tell you the queues are long its rubbish. Dress code rumours are true though, covered shoulders and appropriate shorts/skirts. The Colloseum is 12 euros each - queue was longer but still only 30 minutes. To end on a note about the hotel again - the staff are some of the best ive seen, pleasant, helfpul and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - clean and small”
Reviews.Author: mrmcintosh
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Only about a 5 min walk from the train station, and close to all of the hop-on-hop off buses and such. The room was remodelled recently. VERY nice!! Clean and spacious! They don't have a restaurant. We stayed 4 nights and had a free meal included, but you have to walk 2 blocks away to another restaurant at their sister hotel to get it. Not sure I like that, but... Nice hotel! Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace in the bustle of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: The Camelia hotel is an inexpensive quiet spot within busy Rome. The rooms are clean, cool & quiet. The staff were very helpful, particularly the breakfast stewards & lobby staff who were superb & friendly & never queried our ignorance of their native language. (I make no excuses for that as it was an unplanned trip). The food was fresh & sufficient for a good breakfast meal, with plenty of fluids provided. At other times there was a hot drinks machine in the foyer. We had no complaints & no hassle whatsoever & when we'd had enough of the bustle of Rome we found this place to be a perfect oasis of calm. Access to the main Termini station area is about 150 metres or so & me & the wife, now almost 50 years of age, slowly walked the whole city in the first 2 days of our 5 day trip. The weather was around 30c & night brings no real drop in temperature. I won't talk about what we liked or disliked with Rome. I will just say that we reccomend this hotel for what it is because we personally liked it & enjoyed our stay there. Thankyou hotel Camelia for making it a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly & helpful staff - would return.”
Reviews.Author: Rome_Lover101
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is excellently located 5 minutes walk from the Termini train station. It is surrounded by official buildings and with police cars parked outside the front door most of the time it feels very safe. The room was relatively small, but had everything we needed including: air conditioning, a large comfy bed, clean linen and bathroom with a powerful shower. Breakfast doesn't have a massive choice but you can have as much as you like (rolls, pastries, cereal, fruit, etc). The staff are very friendly and helpful - looking up train times to other towns and printing them off for us. This hotel had everything we required for a 5 night city break. If I return to Rome then I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good small hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: celticboySwansea
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a delight,the staff were helpfull and polite.The rooms are medium sized by european standard and kept very clean(fresh linen each day).Breakfast served from 7 to 10 in a pleasant room.Breakfast was repetitive(eggs, flan, juice good, coffee, rolls ,cheese, jams, fruit, cake,and cereal) but buffet style,so fill up for the day. Reception arranged taxis for us gave us loads of information and tips. There is a good bar around the block,on leaving the hotel turn right ,then right again,pass the deli on the corner (try their takeaway sandwiches)and the tobacconist. The best restaurant we found was the Birreria Peroni on the via ss apostoli off the via del corso,good food reasonable prices and a choice of premium draught beer(9eu per litre).If you want to take an open top bus trip do not pay a deposit at the hotel and commit yourself to one company, walk to the termini bus/train station and only book at the pick up point ,this will ensure you avoid waiting for an empty one to come along,price 19 euros for 24hr hop on and off ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TheTitch
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a romantic getaway for me and my fiance as we have always wanted to see the sights of Rome. I had booked another hotel previously...Hotel Lirico...but I had some trouble with this (read my review on Hotel Lirico, Rome). Anyway, we flew from Liverpool to Ciampino, where we got an airport coach (Terravision) to the main station in Rome, Termini Station. This cost us £10 each return but there are other airport shuttle services offering cheaper prices. From the station the hotel is a two minute walk. Unfortunately, we got ripped off by a taxi man who charged us 20 euros to get there by car, as we didn't know how close the hotel was. Warning! It is easier to walk, it is literally two streets away, so print out a map from Termini to Hotel Camelia before you go. We arrived at the hotel to find friendly staff, and we were pleased that the hotel is right opposite a police station, which made us feel safer, and a big supermarket at the end of the street (you can see this as you turn left out of the hotel doors). This was good to know, we picked up a few snacks and some toiletries from here. They sell everything you need. The room, although not huge, was spotless with modern furnishings. The bathroom was spotless. We had a hairdryer, safe, minibar, TV, two wardrobes and large double bed. The bed was huge and very comfy! They give you a key-card to get in, it felt very posh! Plus this meant we didn't have to lug a big key around everywhere we went. They have a lift, which was convenient for our heavy bags. The rooms were cleaned every day, the bed was made and fresh towels given (you just leave the towels on the floor if you want fresh ones). The mini bar was very reasonably priced, our mini bar bill was only 4 euros 50 when we left. Though this was partly because we bought drinks from the supermarket down the road! After reading the reviews on this site about the continental breakfast we thought it would be awful. It was actually lovely! And we looked forward to it every morning. It is served from 7 til 10am and the last day we didn't get downstairs til half 9 and there was still plenty left, it looked as though it had hardly been touched. This free breakfast was topped off nicely with the hot drinks having been brought to our tables by the waitor. They had a variety of hot drinks to choose from, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, cappuccino, hot milk etc. They also had fresh juice to help yourself to. The breakfast included fruit, croissants, bread, eggs, muesli, cereal, jam, fruit and lots more, we were spoilt for choice. There was a computer in the lobby where you can use the internet for free. I didn't have to wait to use it once, I just jumped straight on. The receptionists were all lovely, they helped us plan our sight seeing and gave us a map. We booked an open-top tour around rome for the last two days. We paid 25 euros each for 48 hours hop-on hop-off service. The bus takes you round all the main sites and you just jump off when you feel like it, then when you're done you wait for the next bus. They usually stop every 20 mins at each stop, traffic permitting. We went with Green Line Tours, but we noticed at least two other services and some were cheaper. You get free headphones that plug in by the seats on the bus, and you get a taped audioguide as you travel around the sites. The first day we were there we walked to the collosseum and roman forum. We found them by accident! They're not far away, and we're both smokers so we're not exactly fit. The national museum of rome is also round the corner opposite termini station. We got discounts at the attractions because we were from the EU and were 18-24 years old. We just showed our driving licenses. I also got a discount at the vatican museum and sistine chapel with my student card. So don't forget to take some ID! It can be as big as 50% discount at some places! I would like to warn people away from the tours for the colleseum and roman forum. We were told that we could pay 18 euros for entry and a full tour without having to wait in the queue, they told us we would get no information once inside. We decided against it, queued up for 5 mins at the most, paid 7 euros 50 to get in with our discount and they also had audioguides for 4 euros 50. But to be honest, if you go on the internet and find out about the sites beforehand you don't need a guide at all! Obviously, the tour operators want to make money out of you so beware! Also, beware of the various people trying to sell you things. They are quite forward and we were grabbed a couple of times, we were almost forced to pay 10 euros for a piece of string that went round our wrists! Thankfully I managed to sweet talk the guy but he got quite irate when I didn't want to buy his bracelet! Obviously because we went in November the attractions weren't too packed but I can imagine they are quite busy in the summer, so be prepared for queues. Anyway, back on to the hotel! All in all it was nice to have a descent place to come back to at the end of the night. The surrounding area wasn't too scary at night either! The only downfall is that we booked bed and breakfast only, so we had to find our own food come evening. But the sister hotel Art Deco is round the corner from Camelia, even though this is relatively expensive compared to the other restaurants in the area. There were several other restaurants and pizzerias, some did take-out as well. There were tabacconists on virtually very street, and there is a cash machine just past the supermarket. If you are unsure, they have all this at Termini Station. Oh and there are McDonalds' EVERYWHERE! (in case you get stuck for food!) We really enjoyed our stay and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: m_difruscia
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I were arriving to Rome by train from Florence. We just needed a place to touch down for one night since we were flying out the next day. Hotel Camelia was exactly what we were looking for. The location was great, about 4-5 blocks from Termini (train) station (10 minute walk). The room size was quite large, very clean, and modern décor. It was air-conditioned. The staff was very friendly and spoke good English. They offer quite a selection of tours that you can purchase directly from the front desk as well as entrance tickets to several popular museums and galleries. There are several good restaurants and bars near by. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again. Be careful though, the price fluctuates significantly depending on the site. I had seen it on Expedia and Travelocity for $200-225US but I booked it through a web site I had never heard of before, Versus, and got it for $99US.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Camelia”
Reviews.Author: sjohn271
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel close to the train station with lovely spotless air conditioned rooms. Spotless in every way. Marco at the front desk was wonderful. I would stay here anytime in Rome LOVED it

Reviews.Title: “Loved Camelia Hotel - cleanest hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: AshleyCheshire
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Camelia Hotel for 3 nights in December 2007. It was for a romantic getaway/birthday treat - I hit the big '30'. The hotel was superb. The staff were great and very helpful on places to eat nearby, and also help as regards the best way to get round the city. The rooms were spotlessly clean, and very nicely furnished - the best I have stayed in. The breakfast is your usual continental - but again a good start to the day. The coffee was lovely. Try local restaurants to the hotel, mama angelos and famigilia restaurants. They were good. Also, there were some nice more expensive restaurants around the republicca stop. Hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the terminal station. The cheapest way to get from Ciampino Airport is by the terravision bus. I paid online via their website before we went, but you can pay on arrival. I think it was 7 euros each. We had a superb time in Rome. It was a lovely break, and I think 3 nights/4 days was just the right amount of time. We found the easiest way to get around was on/off the metro which stopped at all the sites. The colosseum and vatican are a must see. We paid extra outside to queue jump and have a tour of the collosseum which was well worth it. I cant understand other reviews that say the hotel wasnt clean - as it was completely spotless. Tip for cafe nearest the vatican - it is twice as expensive for a coffee if you sit down rather than stand up! You cant go wrong with the Camelia. We paid less than £400 for flights and hotel in December for the long weekend with Cresta Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: legendb
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight on the day of our stay. I rang the guy from the airport to say we would be late. No problem. On arriving the receptionist was friendly and welcoming and gave us a map highlighting all the tourists bits we might be interested in and how to get around (bus numbers etc.) The breakfast is a bit spartan but if you ate pasta and pizza the night before who can handle more than a croissant and some fruit. It was fine but no more than that. First night we wanted to eat in the area, I found a restaurant in our guide book and the receptionist phoned up to check if it was fully booked for the night. It wasn't so another tick. The room was small but big enough for sleeping in comfortably. It had a desk, tv, wardrobe with free safe inside. The bathroom was also compact and the shower would struggle to contain somebody carrying a large gait. It was also clean and looked modern enough. Finally the location is good for the main train station (5min walk) yet also close enough to be walking distance into the touristy bits. We did alot of walking though, It's approx 20 mins to the trevi fountain on foot and about 45 to the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn S
Reviews.Content: Small room with carpet covered in stains. the saving grace was the bathroom which was modern and clean. Service at the 'average' breakfast was impersonal, bordering on rude. At 10.00 on the dot the staff switched off the lights and TV irrespective of how many guests were still eating. We were charged £150 per night for 7 nights by Cresta. Absolutely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: kkonstan
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, very poor breakfast, impolite service. Giving different prices for taxis to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous32
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel which was very easy to find from termini station, just a 10 minute walk. A very good breakfast and extremely friendly and helpful hotel staff. Both bedroom and bathroom were cleaned to a high standard, as was the whole hotel. Also great air conditioning in our room which is great in the summer months. Good location for exploring the city as all attractions can be reached by foot or the metro. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed our stay at Camelia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ObserverToSee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Camelia for 2 nights and had a wonderful experience. The staff are incredibly helpful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Reservations for 2 triple rooms was made only 3 days in advance and when we arrived at the hotel, everything went smoothly. The breakfast was a welcome service and a very good start to each day. The price and location, which is so close to almost everything, are excellent deals especially in our case where it was very short notice. I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeet51
Reviews.Content: Hotel Camilia is perfectly placed for exploring Rome. The hotel is small, attractive and quiet. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The continental breakfast offered good variety of foods. One morning, we had to leave before breakfast, to go on a tour to Pompeii and we were given ample 'breakfast boxes' that kept us going all day ! We shared a triple room at the top [ 4th floor] and were pleased that there was a lift. The room offered two single beds and the third was smaller but fine. The bathroom was compact but excellent and very clean. It's sister hotel Artdeco, just round the corner, served good food. We found a very good resturant about 6 mins away from the hotel. 'al Forno della Soffitta, Via Piave. The food was excellent, service very good and lots of the locals ate there. Great atmosphere. Totally agree with review from April 2007 - supermarket excellent for food and wine to bring home! I would certainly return and hopefully take my two daughters with me.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific little hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: scipio43
Reviews.Content: Hotel Camilia in Rome is located near the termini in Rome. The hotel is not far from a metro stop, but walking to the sites (not very far) is a nice way to see the city. The hotel is small, attractive (seems to have been remodeled), and quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel offers a hardy continental breakfast. I've stayed in different 2 or 3 star hotels on my visits to Rome. Hotel Camilia has been the best so far. A great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not Without Its Problems”
Reviews.Author: Ephebe
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers stated, the hotel is in a great location, and is well kept. But, there are a few things that need to be made aware of. The showers are extremely small. For anyone who lacks agility or is overweight, you may want to keep that in mind. The staff was very friendly, but there were times when they were not entirely helpful. But, it may have been due to something lost in translation. The staff I interacted with seemed to only have a rudimentary knowledge of English. I asked one of the seemingly ever changing desk clerks if the museums and other attractions would be open on April 25th, Liberation Day. She said they wouldn't be. As it turned out, she was incorrect. Of another desk clerk, I asked about the cab I could take directly to the airport. He said he didn't know what I was referring to. To be specific, he said, "I don't know." He advised me to talk with one of his co-workers. Ironically, this clerk, the second I interacted with, was the one on deck the morning I left. When I spoke with the third clerk, he told me the service would cost 60 Euro. It ended up only costing me 40. On my final full day, I really needed to make a call to American Express. The phone in my room was not functioning properly, and there was no other staff to assist me. In response to several of my questions, the fourth clerk said, "I don't know." As it turned out, all the above examples turned out for the best. But, a visitor may have some difficulty if they need to know something from a front desk clerk. To be fair, I had an equal number of examples in which the above employees gave me great assistance. In addition, their knowledge of English is as good as my knowledge of Italian. So I can't fault them much. Overall, I enjoyed staying at this hotel. But I won't stay there again due to the size of the shower. Also, my experiences with the staff has prompted me to expand my knowledge of Italian.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel at a good price value.”
Reviews.Author: katerinaAthens
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 5 days trip to ROME. We stayed at hotel ''CAMELIA'' which we fourd it very nice and at a good price. The hotel is at via Goito (PIAZZA INDIPENDENZA), a nice, peacefull and easy accessible street in the centre not far away from Termini station. By walk is approx. 1O minutes away. If you don't want to walk, there is a bus station almost outside of the hotel, the bus line is (38), that takes you to Termini station. Hotel staff is very gentle and very helpfull. Rooms are renovated recently (not so big not so small) and that is shows.It Iis well cleaned every day, with new towels etc. The room is very pretty with nice curtains, nice bedroom sheets, and a very nice bathroom. It has TV, Mini fridge, a hair druyer and very good air-condition. The breakfast was a small buffet, fine with croissants, marmelades, eggs, coffee, tea. Although we would prefer if it had ham and cheece. Nevertheless, everything was fine. We enjoyed very much our stay. We booked the room throughOCTOPUS TRAVEL, and we couldn't beleive our eyes. It was very good for a 3 star hotel. ROME is a very interesting city which offers you so much. You have so many things to see that 5 days is not enough. Although we walked everyday at least 7-8 hours. A suggestion: buy a card for 6 days that is for all transport(TRAINS, BUSES, ETC). It is cheap...And another suggestion: don't miss VILLA BORGHESE,(BORGHESE GARDENS), the historical centre (COLOSSEUM, PANTHEON, CIRCO MAXIMO), and if you have spair days go to Tivoli, to Villa D'ESTE.... It is absolutely fabulous...Don't miss drinking cappuchino con chocolata in cafe greco and in other cafes around the beautifull piazzas. And don't miss tiramissou and gelato especially in casa del freddo. A good suggestion for lunch is ARMANDO in VIA TIBURTINA. Very nice. That's all. Hope to be helpfull. VAGELIS and KATERINA from GREECE.

Reviews.Title: “Loved rome,not so sure about hotel camelia..”
Reviews.Author: tomjoad
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from 7 nights at hotel camelia which we found adequate for a 3 star budget hotel although lacking in basic facilities like tea and coffee making in room.the staff are extremely friendly and helpfull and maybe 7 out of 10 for room cleanliness.The hotel is within easy walking distance from all the attractions and the area is safe even at night.We found using the metro from termini very easy and at 1 euro a journey good value,daily and weekly tickets can be purchased also.If it is your first visit to rome don't let the reports of petty crime concern you,Rome is much safer than most British cities and everyone is polite,friendly and helpfull.Rome is amazing and 1 week is not enough to do it justice,don't miss St peter's basillica as the inside is possibly the most beutifull of any building on earth.We can't wait to visit Rome again but we wouldn't stay at the hotel camellia again because it is not cheap for a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Godlett
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Rome. When looking for hotels, my brief was to find a centrally located but reasonably priced 3-star (or above) hotel. The Camelia Hotel fitted the bill but I was a bit worried when there was only 1 one review on the Trip Advisor website. I need not have worried - the hotel was ideally located, being 5 minutes walk from the Termini station and within reasonable walking distance of all the main tourist sites (except the Vatican which was easily accessible by the number 64 bus). We would definitely return to the hotel - it was spotlessly clean, had friendly staff, very good bedrooms for a 3-star and had a decent enough breakfast (cereals, rolls/croissants, boiled eggs, fruit, cakes, etc.) If you're looking for somewhere to eat, there's a fantastic restaurant/steakhouse just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxmay
Reviews.Content: A great 3 star hotel.Very friendly and helpfull staff,rooms are of a good size and very clean.The breakfast was good apart from the coffee,but there is a good coffee shop opposite the hotel that was also cheap.The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the termini station,and about 10 to 15 minutes from the Trevi Fountain.I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.
